events.name: Androidy Holiday Beers
events.description:
Let's have a year ending beers together before everyone heads out for holidays. Join us for a chat about everything Android and beer.

https://www.google.de/maps/place/NIEDERLASSUNG/@48.1327802,11.5750436,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x479ddf61ba98083f:0x15c9bd0c175d29e5

events.name: Android Meetup
events.description:
Our first meet-up in 2016 is hosted at 1&1 and comes with 3 great talks:

• Introduction to RxJava/RxAndroid: the RX libraries have gained great popularity among developers lately. RX solves asynchronous programming elegantly based on the Observer pattern. This is especially helpful on Android where lots of interactions are asynchronous to the UI. Speaker: Egor Andreevic

• Complex Android Apps at 1&1: Learn how the Android development team utilizes modern technologies, practices and tools to deliver an Android Mail App to over 10 million users. During the talk you will hear how to setup Gradle to have several flavors with different look and feel, resolve cross reference conflicts and utilize an Artifactory to deploy necessary libraries and APKs. We will also demonstrate how to upload nightly builds into the Play Store Alpha channel. Speaker: Sebastian Paulus

• "Lands of Ruin" App Demo: Lands of Ruin is a new type of hybrid tabletop game combining Android tablet UI with physical miniatures. In the demo Juhani will show the latest iteration of the Android UI and answer any technical questions about the project. Speaker: Juhani Lehtimäki

And thanks to 1&1 Munich, we have a room with great view from the 11th floor, enough food, drinks and beer. Let's have a fun evening!

Parking hint: there may be some free slots in "Pickelstraße" nearby.

Public transport: U1/U7 Westfriedhof, Tram 20/21 Borstei
events.how_to_find_us: 11th floor (most Elevators go to 10th only: take the stairs from here)

events.name: Firebase with Frank van Puffelen from Google
events.description:
Frank van Puffelen from the Firebase team is coming to Munich and we're arranging a special Firebase evening for learning and talking Firebase. 

Note: this is not just for Firebase on Android!

Presentation blurb:

Firebase is the fastest way to build your app. Come and learn how you can build applications quickly without managing complex infrastructure. You'll find out how Firebase's data storage, user management, and asset hosting features work. In addition you'll get to choose, for which platform we'll live-code a chat application. Web? Or Android?

events.name: Android UI Architecture Meetup
events.description:
The UI is an important part of most Android apps. In this meetup, two talks will have a closer look at architectural patterns for developers:

• MVVM/Databinding: Implementing the model view view-model pattern on Android using Android’s databinding library (by Christian Braunschweiler, Noser)

• MVP: Use the Model View Presenter pattern to decouple your components and improve test-ability (Gabriel Weis, Binosys)

And thanks to our Event sponsor 1&1, there will be free food and drinks.

And for the soccer fans: We are aware of the semi-finals starting at 9 PM. We will plan the event so that you won't miss the game. If enough people are interested, we might consider watching it together somewhere.

events.name: Munich Mobile Hack Night

venue.name: Digital Workshop Trainings Center in Munich

events.description:
Let's write some hobby-project code together!

Bring your laptop and mobile device and come join everyone else for a night of coding, chatting and beer drinking. In this event there won't be any formal programme. The idea is for everyone to bring their hobby project and get some coding done. You can work alone or as teams. This is not a hackathon as such so no judging or prices but beer should be plenty and hopefully pizza as well! :-)

It's very difficult to find time to get that hobby project started that you've always wanted to do.. Now it's perfect time to do that! Or maybe you're stuck with yours and need help. I bet other people are more than happy to brainstorm solutions to your problems. You might even find new team members to your project and push it to the next level!

Note that places for this event are very limited due to the nature of the event (everyone needs a table)! Please RSVP "yes" ONLY if you're coming and if you have a seat reserved but can't make it please cancel your reservation so someone else will have room.

This event is a joint event together with the awesome Munich iOS Developers Meetup group. It's a great opportunity to get to know some of the local iOS developers as well! Note that you only need to reserve a place for you in one of the groups. You don't need to reserve for both group events.. it's the same event :-)

events.name: Android Meetup
events.description:
Our next meet-up is hosted by freeletics and comes with min. 2 talks.

If you're interested in giving a talk or introduce a private project or app, please let us know.

• Building an offline first app for Android Wear using Firebase: A show and tell of an android  wear app using firebase Speaker: Steren Giannini

• Wouldn't it be great if your testing procedure was just a matter of looking through a folder of screenshots to see if everything looked as expected. No more manual testing or following complicated scripts to reproduce all the edge cases! It's possible, but it'll take some work. Speaker: Edward Dale

•  How we use RxJava at Freeletics. Speaker: Dmytro Khmelenko 

Parking hint: there may be some free slots in "Nymphenburger Str." nearby.

Public transport: U1/U7 Maillingerstraße, Tram 20/21/22/N20, Bus 50

events.name: Android Beers
events.description:
Let's have some beers together and talk Android. No formal talks in this event. Just socialising with fellow geeks!

Meet you at Niederlassung!

Please note: no free beer in this event. Please take care of your own bill!

events.name: 1st Android Meetup 2017
events.description:
Hello Android developers - we hope you had a great start in 2017! Our first meetup this year comes with two talks:

• Android Things: Introduction to the IoT platform based on Android (formerly known as Brillo) by Egor Andreevich. We will also show one or two Raspberry Pis with Rainbow Hats if you are interested in the hardware.

• ObjectBox: a new mobile database launched today. It offers superfast object persistence. By Markus Junginger.

• Model-View-Intent: Lightning talk on the pattern separate model and view in a RxJava context. By Hannes Dorfmann.

Google will also provide drinks and snacks - it will be a fun evening ahead. :)
events.how_to_find_us: Get your name tag at the Google reception and then take the elevator to the 6th floor to the event space

events.name: Firebase Evening
events.description:
Firebase is Google's serverless backend for mobile and web. It's a powerful tool in any mobile dev's arsenal. Join us to learn more!

Firebase Evening is a joint event together with iOS Meetup Munich. The event is split into 2 parts:

19:00-20:00

1) Platform specific introduction and "getting-started" type of presentation for Android and iOS (we have separate spaces for the groups). This will be the first 45 minutes of the meetup. If you're already familiar with Firebase you should skip this first part and join us at 20.00. 

20:00->

2) Platform independent presentations:

• Firebase Cloud Functions by Tim Messerschmidt (Google) https://twitter.com/SeraAndroid

• Firebase security and authentication by Enrique López Mañas (GDE) https://twitter.com/eenriquelopez

NOTE: If you’re member of both meetup groups, GDG Android Munich and iOS Meetup Munich, please RSVP only to one of the groups so the seat reservations will match.

Space to this event is limited. Please cancel your RSVP in case you cannot make it to let someone else join!

events.name: I/O 2017 Extended Munich
events.description:
We will live stream the Google I/O keynote.

Agenda:

18:00 Doors open, socializing with gBräu and snacks

18:50 Pizza is served

19:00 Live streaming of the Keynote

20:30 Some more gBräu

21:15 End

events.name: Getting Started with Kotlin in Android
events.description:
As you are all aware, Kotlin is now officially supported by Google as a first-class language.

To get all of us started with the language we're joining forces with the Munich Kotlin user group.

Please, RVSP to participate (half to be booked at the GDG and half at the KTUG). If RSVP runs out, please join the waiting list. Only RSVP to one of the meetups, not both!

Meetup Agenda

19:00 Doors open, hang out with drinks and pizza

19:30 Enrique Lopez-Manas: Introduction to Kotlin for Android Devs

19:45 Egor Andreevici: Testing with Kotlin

20:15 Dmitry Jemerov: How to learn Kotlin
events.how_to_find_us: Please use the *right* side entrance (JetBrains Event Space)

events.name: Munich Mobile Hack Day - Animations
events.description:
This is not a normal meetup, please read instructions fully before RSVPing!

Munich Mobile Hack Days are all about getting us working on our hobby projects and pushing them forward. This hack day we are focusing on animations. Does your hobby project need to add the next level of polish with meaningful animations? Join us for a day of learning and hacking.

If you don’t have your own project yet maybe now is the perfect time to start one? Or maybe you can find a project looking for help you can join?
In case you don’t have time for a full project right now, don’t worry, we will also have challenges and exercises for implementing animations for learning purposes.

Initial schedule (subject to change):

10:00 - 10:45: Animations on Android / Animations on iOS presentation (intermediate level, separated by platform)

12:00 -> Hacking your own projects
12:00 -> Lightning talks on various related topics
12:00 -> Exercises and challenges

22:00 -> Demos and show & tell. Show others what you done!

Please notice that in this event everyone will be first added to the waiting list. Latest 10th June we will be adding accepted participants to “YES” RSVP list manually. This is due to the limited participant numbers we can host. This also means that, please, remove yourself from the waiting list if you can’t make it to the event. Also, please take time to fill in the RSVP questions carefully.

This is a joint event with the local iOS meetup group. Please do not register to both events. Just choose one!

There will be room for approximately[masked] participants.

Microsoft is kindly providing a great venue for the event hosting it in the company's German headquarters. MS will also be providing catering (pizza & beer) for all participants.

SPONSORS WANTED:
It’s always nice if the best hacks can be rewarded at the end of the day. If you are a company willing to contribute product prizes please get in touch with the Hack Day organisers.

events.name: Android Meetup
events.description:
This meet-up is hosted by jambit. Thanks to Johanna Pröhl for offering.

If you're interested in giving a talk or introduce a private project or app, please let us know.

Color-Management-System on Android O

Fabian Eichinger

This talk is an introduction to the improved color handling in Android O and some of the fundamentals behind it. We will go over the effects on the graphics framework, changes and pitfalls that designers and programmers should be aware of. We will also take a look at some use-cases for related new APIs.


Testing support library: 2 years later...

Anas Ambri

In this talk, we will take a look at how modern Android apps can be tested, along with some practical tips that were collected during the 6-month process of introducing unit and integration tests to the Scalable Capital Android app.


Parking hint: there may be some free slots in "Erika-Mann-Str." nearby. There is also a Parking Lot nearby.

Public transport: 

• S1 / S2 / S3 / S4 / S6 / S7 / S8 / BOB / M at Donnersbergerbrücke

• Bus 53 / 63 at Donnersbergerbrücke

events.name: GDG Android + KTUG Kotlin Meetup November
events.description:
Join a joint Kotlin KTUG and GDG Android Munich meetup to discuss and learn about Koltin.

19:00 Doors open, hang out with drinks and pizza 

19:30 Juhani Lehtimäki: A quick overview of my experiences on moving from Java to Kotlin. Best resources and pitfalls I fell into.

19:45 Dmitry Borodin: How to find views in Android - nice example of the power of language

20:10 Eugene Petrenko: Kotlin DSLs in 42 minutes

DO NOT REGISTER TO BOTH EVENTS. ONLY GDG or KTUG!

See more info:
https://www.meetup.com/Kotlin-User-Group-Munich/events/244174864/

SPONSORS WANTED:

events.description:
• What we'll do
Munich Mobile Hack Days are all about getting us working on our hobby projects and pushing them forward. We do not have a specific focus or topic this time. Just come and join fellow geeks to have a day of hobby project fun!

This is a joint event together with the Munich iOS Developers meetup (https://www.meetup.com/The-Munich-iOS-Developers-Meetup/) and GDG Munich Gophers (https://www.meetup.com/Munich-Gophers-Go-User-Group/)! Food and Drinks are sponsored. No need to bring your own meat. There will also be vegetarian food.

The schedule is just an estimate. It might change.

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
events.description:

Its called DACHFest this time! And again, it will happening in munich again.

Things did change this year:
- its a two-day conference

- available scholarships

Please visit our website dachfest.com for Tickets

and of course, follow us on Twitter @dachfest

events.name: (almost) winter solstice beers
events.description:
Informal meetup with no set schedule or talks. Just come by and enjoy some drinks and nerdy discussions.

Table is reserved under "GDG Munich Android" for 10 people. Seats with first-come-first-seated principal.

Note that drinks/food are not free in this event. Please pay your tap before leaving.

events.name: Munich Mobile Hack Weekend
events.description:
Munich Mobile Hack Days / Weekends are informal gatherings for people to work on their hobby projects and to hangout with fellow mobile developer nerds.

This event is organised together with the Munich iOS Meetup group.

There is no program, no schedule, no presentations and no free food (we'll order something together) but drinks are provided by the location sponsor Snapp Mobile!

As the space is very small we can invite only around 10 people total. If you want to participate please email me at [masked] directly and answer the following questions. I will confirm each participant personally latest Thursday:

1) Do you plan to come by Saturday / Sunday / both?
2) Do you already have a hobby, side project in mind? If so please tell about it (just 1-2 sentences is enough)
3) Have you attended the GDG Munich Android meetups lately?

Note: registration to this event cannot be done via Meetup.com. Email me directly if you want to join!
events.how_to_find_us:
Inner Yard, right side, stairs up to 1st floor.
If you can't find, ping me at at Telegram: JuhaniLehtimaeki or 
SMS to: +49 176 70892893 and I'll come find you by the entrance.

events.name: Febrary Meetup, Coroutines on Android
events.description:
Hey everyone, coroutines everywhere, at twitter, reddit, youtube and in your android code. So we thought it is time to get some talks on this topic.

19:00 - meet and greet
19:30 - Introduction to Kotlin Coroutines: what, why and how? (Dmitry Borodin)
20.15 - How to continue work even when children tasks fail or timeout (Wahib Ul Haq)

As always, if you want to demo, talk about, ask questions for your hobby projects let us know. There's always time for demos!
events.how_to_find_us:
You can travel by S7 and S20.
There are also parking slots available.

events.name: March Meetup, Animations and more
events.description:
Our March Meetup is going to have two talks, beer (and other drinks) and pizza!

----
*Make your life easier in Gradle multimodule project*
Yahor Bednikau (https://twitter.com/Tapchicoma_eng)

Splitting monolith to multi-module project is a new trend in Android world. In this talk, I will provide few advices how to make your life easier with Gradle setup in mulimodule project.

----
*Meaningful motion design and how to implement it*
Juhani Lehtimaki (https://twitter.com/lehtimaeki), Pierluigi Rufo (https://twitter.com/pierluigirufo)

Android apps are not just series of static screens. To create a great app you will have to bring it into life with meaningful, helpful and delightful motion.

However, a good design is not worth much unless it gets implemented correctly. In this joint designer-developer talk we discuss the workflow from the idea, to design and development and all the way to user’ hands.

We describe when to use motion and when not to as well as selecting the right type and right intensity of motion. We then dive into the best implementation strategies including communicating state, navigation, feedback, tutorial and delightful animations.

events.name: April meetup
events.description:
Our April meetup will have two talks:

Modularization by Ben Weiss (Google)
Best of login experience by Dmytro Khmelenko

NOTE: Your meetup profile must have your real name as Google requires that BEFORE the meetup. We will hand over list of people attending to Google the previous day and badges will be printed beforehand. If your profile is not your real name, message one of the organisers with message telling what name we should give to Google. If you don't have a real name and have not messaged us when the RSVP closes we will remove you from the attendee list and you will lose your spot.

Space is limited. PLEASE CANCEL IF YOU CAN'T MAKE IT!
events.how_to_find_us: Get your badge at the lobby. The event is in the top floor event space.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Munich 2019
events.description:
Google I/O 2019! Let's enjoy the live stream of the event together in Munich.

You were too late to get a spot? There's a **second** location at 1und1 - check this event: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Munich-Android/events/260639431/

Preliminary Agenda:
17:30 Arrival, networking, food & drinks
19:00 Key Note
20:45 Lightning talks
21:45 Developer Key Note
22:45 End

NOTE: If you are attending, we need your first and last name. If your meetup profile does not show your real name, please change that or reach out to us and tell us. This is required for attending the meeting.

Logistics update:
Please double-check the location (there are several IO Extended events in Munich) and if you are still able to make it. If not, PLEASE UPDATE your RSVP status asap. This allows other people to join the event (we are overbooked with more than 100 people on the waitlist!).

Make sure to use your FULL REAL NAME (first and last name) with your Meetup account; we need this for Google security. If you don't want to do this, please message me with your real name. We have to remove people that are still lacking the full name by Monday morning.

RSVP changes can be done before Monday 12:00 (noon). After that your RSVP status is final.

That's it for logistics. Looking forward to seeing you on Tuesday!

events.name: Google I/O Extended Munich 2019, 2nd Location at 1&1
events.description:

Lightning talks: Please reach out to us if you would like to present. events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Munich

events.description:
This event is a joint event organised together with the GDG Munich Android and the Kotlin User Group Munich.

events.name: September Meetup, Jetpack and more
events.description:
After a long summer brake, we're back on track. Let's see what you can do with the new android x libraries (Android Q > Android 10 > Android X??)

----
*Clean Architecture with Redux in Android*
Catalin Comarnescu

---

*Jetpack - Navigation Components*
Wahib Haq (https://twitter.com/wahibhaq)

Navigation Component is the new talk of the town in the Android world. I got a chance to use it to rewrite (work-in-progress) a sub-section of an existing app and would like to share an initial impression, basic how-tos, challenges and what it has to offer.
----

*Androidx Paging Library with GraphQL*
Leon Füßner (https://twitter.com/leon_fuessner)

How we implemented the new paging library in our new group feature at Spontacts

----

As always, we have limited space. So please cancel your RVSP not 5 minutes before the event. Give everyone a chance to join.
events.how_to_find_us:
Entry: Westwing GmbH
An easy way to find us, is by Public transport U3 to Oberwiesenfeld.

events.name: Cross-platform special
events.description:
This is a special joint event with the Munich Kotlin meetup (KTUG) and the Munich Flutter meetup.

NOTE! RSVP only to ONE of the groups. Each group have their own allocation of spots.

Also note that we're starting earlier than we normally do as we have 4 talks!

Please check the schedule again later. It might change!

Schedule:

2. "Flutter and Dart" - Vince Varga // 30 MINUTES
3. "Converting to Kotlin Multiplatform" - Jossi Wolf // 30 MINUTES

If this group is full you can also RSVP at the Flutter meetup of KTUG:
(only RSVP in ONE group)
https://www.meetup.com/Flutter-Munich/events/265931319
https://www.meetup.com/Kotlin-User-Group-Munich/events/265932284

The event will be full. In case you can't make it please update your RSVP to free your spot to someone else. No-shows will be at the end of the line in the next limited space event.

group_profile.intro: Chief Android @ greenrobot, Open Source, ObjectBox

Android developer.
